And accordingly 14 Junii, 1565, upon a Report from the At¬ torney General, and Advice with the two Chief Justices, a general Direction was given by the Queen and her Council, That all Suits
That for want of Children, the Father or Mother inherited before the Brother or Sister
That for want of Children, and Father, Mother, Brother, and Sister, the Land descended to the Uncles and Aunts to the fifth Generation
That in Successions Collateral, Proximity of Blood was pre¬ ferred
That the Male was preferred before the Female, i.e. The Father’s Line was preferred before the Mother’s, unless the Land descended from the Mother, and then the Mother’s Line was preferred

title: GRAY has taught at the Massachusetts Institute of Tech¬ nology and the University of Chicago. From 1965 through 1970 he was coeditor of the Journal of Modern History
